PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 11 Our preliminary investigation on the photovoltaic properties of PCDSeBT in typical BHJ devices with [6,6]-phenyl C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) shows a highly respectrable PCE of 4.12% on account of the high J SC and V OC .

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| J SC |
| V OC |
| PCE |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the updated table with only the entities that clearly refer to material properties:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| J SC |
| V OC |

The entities "J SC" and "V OC" are both material properties that are relevant to the performance of photovoltaic devices. "J SC" refers to the short-circuit current density, which is a measure of the maximum current that can be generated by a solar cell, while "V OC" refers to the open-circuit voltage, which is the maximum voltage that can be generated by a solar cell when it is not connected to a load.

* J SC stands for Short-Circuit Current
* V OC stands for Open-Circuit Voltage
